item.title: Report E-2025020001
item.description:
Report E-2025020001

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-27
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 27, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN1789 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remove all released material from the dock floor. LSH containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 5-gallon pail and all other debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2025010429

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: SUGAR LAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 30, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of ink was damaged during loading and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all material in one (1) 5-gallon drum. The damaged drum of ink was overpacked for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025011298
item.description:
Report X-2025011298

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: Longview
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: ***Upon notification, I contacted Code 3 to respond with a crew and I was enroute. I was advised by yard personnel that the cloud was on the top of the car and would "cycle", starting and stopping, and all personnel were clear of the area and there was no movement in the yard, except for the mainline. Upon Code 3 arrival, the car was assessed and determined to have a PRD instead of a rupture disc. The leak was coming from the liquid connection flange, there was no cloud and was wisping out faintly. Code 3 exited the car and updated me. I contacted Reagent Chemical and advised him of the incident and was provided photos of how the flange should look with a gasket visible between the red and black spacers. Code 3 climbed the car and completed a more thorough inspection and found that the liquid flange bolts were easily turned by hand and no gasket was visible. The bolts were tightened and the off gassing slowed. There was moisture in the air which reacted with the HCL vapor and created a pH of 1 on top of the liquid line. The car was decontaminated with soda ash and water and the off gassing stopped. The car was moved to the Rip track, yard operations resumed, and there was no off gassing during the move. The air flange was removed to check for pressure and a vacuum was on the car. Then the liquid flange and spacer was removed, no gasket was installed, so a neoprene gasket was installed, and the liquid flange and spacer reinstalled. No further issues. Reagent Chemical sent a certified repair personnel out the afternoon of 1/29/25, installed a new gasket, checked the car for other issues, and prepped the car for Home Shop. Car is still in HZ hold.

item.description:
Report X-2025011007

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

item.title: Report E-2025010337
item.description:
Report E-2025010337

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 20, 2025, at 1309 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Laredo, TX regarding the release of Reze-Meric 9772. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1.0 ounce of Reze-Meric 9772 (UN1866, 3, II) from (2) 231-gallon poly totes onto the (2) totes. The release was reportedly due loose caps, impacting multiple areas on top of the leaked totes. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors tightened the caps on all totes of product and no totes were found to be damaged. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

This allowed approximately 40 gallons of gasoline to be released. ES & H Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2025010050
item.description:
Report I-2025010050

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: El Paso
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS-NOLWOOD CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4370
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival to Ft. Bliss to deliver chlorine cylinders, the customer noticed liquid on the back of the truck which was not present at check in at security. Upon investigation, the driver found the 330 gallon tote of 12.5 wt% sodium hypochlorite to be Leaking. The entire contents of the tote then drained on to the ground. There was no way to stop the leak as it was determined that the bladder had a crack in it at the bottom of the IBC and could not be safely stopped. The area was secured with no personnel exposure. Once a reportable quantity was calculated, NRC was contacted as well as TCEQ and reported the incident. An environmental company, D&H Environmental Services was contacted for remediation. The company applied sodium thiosulfate to the area and tilled the soil. Sampling was done and will be retested in a couple of weeks to ensure the treatment is sufficient. If more treatment is needed, it will be done at that time.
